result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 8:51AM Defendant Ben P Bergee in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen, both appearing by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Cohen acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  DEF verifies name, address, and DOB are correct.  DEF agrees with time limit waiver.  Court sets STC fore 6/7/22 at 10:00AM.  Court instruct Atty Cohen that DEF must appear in person for future court dates.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:34 PM   Court calls case and recites appearances. DA Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE appeared in person with Atty Wilhelm, by Special Appearance.  State addresses Court, has received police report.  Atty Wilhelm requests DE be allowed to appear by ZOOM for next hearing.  Court grants request, DE to be w/Atty at his office by ZOOM.  Initial set for March 15, 2022 @ 8:30 AM

No contact with any juvenile under the age of 17 -   Absolute Sobriety/ No possession of Alcoholic BEverages. May not posess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.  No drug use without a valid perscription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.

No contact with any juvenile under the age of 17 -   Absolute Sobriety/ No possession of Alcoholic BEverages. May not posess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.  No drug use without a valid perscription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.

10:43 AM  Case called.  ADA Gross appeared for State of WIsconsin. DE Ben Bergee appeared with Atty Otten, appearing by video.  Probable cause found.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond.  Court sets bond.   $ 10,000 cash bond - No contact with any juvenile under the age of 17 -   Absolute Sobriety/ No possession of Alcoholic BEverages. May not posess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.  No drug use without a valid perscription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  Initial set for 3/8/2022 @ 8:30 AM.
